description: Financial technology executives plan to promote dollar-backed stablecoins as a way to lower transaction costs for US consumers and businesses at a key congressional hearing on Tuesday as political momentum builds for regulatory legislation to expand use of the tokens.
title: Stablecoin Backers Promote Lower Costs in Quest for Legislation

description: Energy industry groups are calling on the G7 governments to diversify away from Russian gas and consider the role of liquefied natural gas as global energy security.
title: Energy Groups Urge G-7 Nations to Cut Dependence on Russian Gas

description: The UK’s Labour government will introduce long-promised legislation on Tuesday to speed up planning decisions as ministers seek to help stimulate growth through a step-change in housebuilding and by unblocking infrastructure projects from roads to wind farms.
title: UK Pushes Planning Bill to Unblock Infrastructure Projects

description: Syria’s president and the head of the US-backed Syrian Democratic Forces signed an agreement to integrate the Kurdish-led armed group into state institutions, a boost to the country’s interim authorities who’ve been embroiled in deadly clashes since last week.
title: Syria Signs Anticipated Deal to Integrate US-Backed Armed Group

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced he has canceled almost all programs run by USAID, marking the culmination of a plan to dismantle the world’s largest aid agency that began almost from the moment President Donald Trump took office.
title: Rubio Calls USAID Review Done After Speedy Appraisal Sows Chaos

description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright said the Trump administration is prepared to enforce US sanctions on Iranian oil production.
title: Trump Administration Prepared to Enforce Iran Oil Sanctions

description: Billionaire presidential adviser Elon Musk called entitlement spending — benefits including Social Security and Medicare — key targets for cuts, an assertion that directly contradicts President Donald Trump’s pledge to not touch those programs.
title: Musk Calls Entitlements the ‘Big One’ to Cut, Countering Trump

description: US President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet with top business executives on Tuesday, as industry leaders grapple with uncertainty about wide-ranging tariffs and a market selloff driven by recession fears.
title: Trump to Address Top CEOs, Wall Street Bank Executives Tuesday

description: President Donald Trump’s envoy to the Middle East, Steve Witkoff, plans to visit Moscow for a meeting with President Vladimir Putin, people familiar with the matter said, as the administration looks to secure a cease-fire in the Ukraine conflict.
title: Trump’s Mideast Envoy Expected to Meet Putin in New Moscow Visit

description: La Policía está interceptando llamadas y apareciéndose en las casas de las personas, lo que inquieta a algunos ciudadanos y plantea dudas sobre la privacidad.
title: China decide sacrificar la privacidad de sus ciudadanos para protegerlos de las estafas

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Starting today and every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Threats, Chips Subsidies and the Price of Eggs

description: Germany’s Greens demanded tougher rules for defense spending, making a counteroffer in talks aimed at unleashing hundreds of billions of euros for a prospective ruling coalition of the conservatives and the Social Democrats.
title: German Greens Propose Tighter Restrictions on Defense Spending

description: Venezuela will stop receiving deportees from the US in response to President Donald Trump’s decision to revoke Chevron Corp’s license to operate in the South American country.
title: Venezuela Stops Taking US Deportees After Trump Orders Chevron Out

description: What had been a steady pullback from the US stock market accelerated sharply Monday as investors retreated from virtually every type of risk.
title: Markets Rocked by Trump Show Economic Fear Across Wall Street

description: The US moved closer to auctioning off sanctioned Russian billionaire Suleiman Kerimov’s superyacht, one of the most glittering prizes in its asset seizure efforts, after a federal judge ruled that a second Russian who claims ownership has no legal standing in the case.
title: Russian Yacht Valued at $300 Million Now Faces Forfeiture

description: Poland will face consequences if it introduces a levy on large technology companies, the incoming US envoy to Warsaw warned on Monday, as the spat between the two allies escalated.
title: US Says Will Retaliate If Poland Introduces Tax on Big Tech

description: French President Emmanuel Macron signed a letter of intent to promote cooperation between the country’s agency that tracks foreign digital interference and its Moldovan counterpart.
title: France to Help Moldova Fight Against Foreign Cyber Threats

description: Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency has sent three individuals with experience in private equity and finance to the Social Security Administration, highlighting the focus that President Donald Trump is putting on rooting out waste and fraud in the nation’s social insurance programs.
title: Musk Taps Private Equity Veterans to Aid DOGE at Social Security

description: The Trump administration’s support of crypto currencies could hurt Europe’s monetary autonomy, supporting the case for a digital euro, according to a top EU official.
title: US Crypto Push Threatens EU’s Strategic Autonomy, ESM Chief Says

description: Tuesday’s US-Ukraine meeting in Saudi Arabia is intended to help clarify what concessions might be possible in the push toward a ceasefire with Russia, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said, playing down the possibility of a major breakthrough.
title: Ukraine Meeting Intended to Clarify What’s Possible, Rubio Says

description: Czech Prime Minister Petr Fiala called on the opposition to support higher defense spending as geopolitical risks become a contentious campaign issue before parliamentary elections.
title: Czech Premier Urges Opposition to Back Defense Spending Boost

description: Markets believe that additional outlays for defense are better served by joint European Union borrowing instead of expanding individual countries’ debt load, according to European Stability Mechanism Managing Director Pierre Gramegna.
title: EU Bailout Fund Chief Says Markets Prefer Joint Debt for Defense

description: Italy plans to propose a new financial vehicle to mobilize hundreds of billions of euros of private capital for strategic defense and aerospace projects via European Union and member state guarantees.
title: Italy Pitches €200 Billion Investment Plan to Tap Private Funds

description: Tesla Inc. shares are on track for their steepest drop since 2020 as Wall Street analysts begin to slash their estimates for vehicle deliveries.
title: Tesla Shares Plummet as Wall Street Rethinks Sales Projections

description: World No. 3 copper supplier Peru will send a delegation to meet with US officials after the Trump administration announced plans to introduce copper tariffs that threaten to disrupt metal trade flows.
title: Peru Prepares US Delegation in Bid to Avert Copper Tariffs

description: Mark Carney began laying the groundwork to take over quickly as Canada’s prime minister, with lawmakers and cabinet ministers holding key meetings Monday after Liberal Party members chose him as their new leader.
title: Carney Gets Down to Work as Canada Election Drumbeat Intensifies

description: The insurgent Reform UK party descended into bitter infighting following a falling-out between its leader, Nigel Farage, and the man Elon Musk touted just two months ago as his potential replacement.
title: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Stumbles Amid Feud With Rival Backed by Elon Musk

description: During a visit to soldiers on the border with Russia, the Ukrainian military’s Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi said Moscow’s efforts to cut off Ukrainian soldiers holding nearby Russian territory had not succeeded.
title: Ukraine Army Chief Syrskyi Says Units in Kursk Not Encircled

description: The number of migrants trying to reach the US by trekking through the jungle to Central America plunged 99% last month, potentially improving strained relations between Panama and US President Donald Trump.
title: Migration to the US Through Panama Jungle Route Plunges 99%

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is targeting people with dual citizenship as part of a broadening crackdown ahead of elections next year.
title: Orban Threatens Dual Citizens With Expulsion Before Hungary Vote

description: The head of the conservative House Freedom Caucus predicted Monday that Congress will raise the $10,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction, a sign that deficit hawks will not stand in the way of SALT changes later this year.
title: SALT Cap Increase Gets Boost From House Freedom Caucus Leader

description: Harvard University is imposing a temporary pause on hiring of staff and faculty, as the risk of federal funding cuts by the Trump administration threatens the finances of American colleges.
title: Harvard Says It’s Temporarily Freezing Hiring of Staff, Faculty

description: Slawomir Mentzen, who has been skeptical of providing support for Ukrainians living in Poland, moved into second place in the latest opinion poll ahead of the presidential ballot in May.
title: Ukraine-Skeptic Mentzen Gains Support Before Polish Election

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is often the odd man out in the European Union, especially since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. He’s been essentially alone in pushing back against Western efforts to come to Kyiv’s aid and a lone voice in calling for the bloc’s sanctions against Russia to be lifted.
title: Why EU Partners Have Had Enough of Viktor Orban’s Stonewalling

description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright extended a permit for a natural gas export project by Delfin LNG LLC.
title: US Approves Permit Extension for Delfin LNG Export Project

description: One of the very first headlines from the CERAWeek by S&P Global energy conference offers a sneak peek into what is likely the biggest theme coming into 2025: tariffs.
title: Alberta’s Smith Sees No Tariff-Related Slowdown to Oil Output

description: The US Supreme Court refused to revive a $1.6 billion award against International Business Machines Corp., which was accused by KKR & Co.’s BMC Software of poaching a client in violation of a licensing agreement.
title: IBM Spared $1.6 Billion Award as Supreme Court Rejects BMC

description: The US Supreme Court refused to consider an unusual bid by 19 Republican-run states to derail a set of lawsuits that seek to hold oil and gas companies accountable for climate change.
title: Supreme Court Rebuffs GOP-Backed Bid to Stop Climate Suits

description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider whether scores of state and local governments are violating the Constitution by barring licensed counselors from trying to change a child’s sexual orientation or gender identity.
title: Supreme Court Will Review Ban on LGBTQ ‘Conversion Therapy’

description: Canadians appeared to be abandoning road trips to the US amid President Donald Trump’s sovereignty and economic threats to their country.
title: Canadian Travel to US Plummets Amid Tariff, Statehood Threats

description: TWG Global hired Amos Hochstein, one of former President Joe Biden’s most senior Middle East envoys, to help expand its investments in the artificial intelligence and energy sectors amid soaring demand for the technology and electricity that powers it.
title: TWG Hires Top Biden Middle East Envoy Hochstein for AI, Energy

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is planning a second meeting of allies considering sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine as part of any postwar settlement, his spokesman said on Monday.
title: UK’s Starmer Plans Fresh Ukraine Peacekeeping Meeting This Week

description: At 1789 Capital, the president’s eldest son is chasing profit in the ‘parallel’ economy of Trump’s America.
title: Donald Trump Jr. Has Big Plans for Monetizing MAGA

description: Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal ejected the Social Democratic Party from his coalition after his government’s approval ratings hit their lowest in more than two decades.
title: Estonian Premier Kicks Out Coalition Partner as Ratings Dive

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa’s legal team is set to begin negotiations to settle a lawsuit filed against him and several government agencies by families of the victims of apartheid-era crimes, who say the state has stymied their attempts to get justice.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Seeks Settlement With Apartheid Victims

description: Germany’s Green party rejected a draft debt-financed package that would unleash hundreds billions of euros in defense and infrastructure spending, potentially leaving chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz without a supermajority needed to pass the legislation.
title: German Greens Reject Merz’s Defense Spending Plan for Now

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Musk’s Political Activism Has Triggered a Growing Backlash

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he had officially canceled 83% of USAID’s contracts and that his agency will administer its few remaining programs.
title: Rubio Says USAID Will Be Part of State, Face Deep Cuts

description: Three senators are calling on Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to disclose what he and President Donald Trump discussed with drugmakers during closed-door conversations.
title: Senators Say Kennedy Must Disclose Details on Drugmaker Meetings

description: Even before Donald Trump said he would pull $400 million in funding from Columbia University on Friday, officials at the wealthiest US colleges were making efforts to fight monetary salvos from his administration.
title: Wealthiest Colleges Fight to Protect Their Riches From Taxation

description: Rare tensions are surfacing between Israel and President Donald Trump’s administration, after the US engaged in direct negotiations with Hamas regarding hostages in Gaza, including an American national.
title: Trump-Israel Tensions Begin to Surface Over Gaza Hostage Talks

description: China’s Passenger Car Association warned that Elon Musk’s foray into politics risks hurting Tesla Inc.’s already plunging electric vehicle sales.
title: Elon Musk’s Politics May Hurt Tesla Sales, China Car Group Says

description: US and Ukrainian officials will meet in Saudi Arabia this week to discuss the timing and scope of an initial ceasefire with Russia, with multiple points of tension still to be ironed out.
title: US to Press Ukraine for Ceasefire Commitments at Saudi Meeting

description: New York City’s controversial congestion pricing initiative is gradually gaining support, although the new toll has yet to win over a majority of voters.
title: NYC Congestion Pricing Toll Gains Support Among City Residents

description: Here's where the Elon Musk effort has run into court restrictions — and where it hasn't
title: DOGE’s Push for Americans’ Data Meets Mixed Response From Judges

description: The US accounted for the majority of arms imports by European NATO states in the last four years, a Swedish research group found, highlighting their dependence at a time when transatlantic relations are fraying.
title: European NATO States Still Depend on US Arms Imports, SIPRI Says

description: Romania’s largest far-right party signaled it may seek an alternative candidate in May’s presidential election after the front-runner it backed was barred from the race, triggering street protests and risking the wrath of the Trump administration.
title: Romanian Far-Right Regroups as Frontrunner Barred From Vote

description: Thailand’s government plans to inject more cash to push growth beyond 3% this year, as the export-reliant economy faces headwinds from global trade tensions and a volatile local currency.
title: Thailand Readies $800 Million in New Cash Handout to Spur Growth

description: China has once again extended the payment deadline for a loan to Pakistan, as the South Asian nation continues to look for support from friendly nations to rebuild its fragile economy.
title: China Eases Pakistan’s Burden With a $2 Billion Debt Rollover

description: Indonesia is proposing hiking royalties paid by miners in a bid to bolster public finances that are being strained by President Prabowo Subianto’s spending plans.
title: Indonesia Mulls Tax Hikes on Miners Due to Budgetary Pressures

description: North Korea fired multiple ballistic missiles off its west coast Monday, South Korea’s military said, as Pyongyang shows little sign of holding back from its missile testing following Donald Trump’s return to power.
title: North Korea Fires First Ballistic Missiles Since Trump’s Return

description: The political center is shrinking, making it difficult to enact the sort of changes the country needs to jump-start growth and restore competitiveness.
title: Germany Is Suffering an Identity Crisis 80 Years in the Making

description: The nation’s staunchest defenders are being betrayed.
title: There’s Never Been a Better Time to Be Anti-American

description: A former Australian prime minster said the Trump administration’s treatment of longtime allies was providing an opportunity for China, in remarks that came shortly before the US president delivered a personal rebuff.
title: Trump’s Chaos Is a Gift to Xi Jinping, Ex-Australian PM Says

description: The US is trying to speed up arms shipments to Taiwan, according to the de facto ambassador to Taipei, comments likely to reassure officials in Taipei worried about the Trump administration pausing military aid for Ukraine.
title: US Says It’s Pushing to Speed Up Taiwan Weapons Shipments

description: Chinese tariffs on a slew of American farm products have officially come into effect, the latest retaliation in the unfolding trade war between the world’s top two economies.
title: China Deploys Food as High-Impact, Low-Cost Weapon In Trade War

description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is downgrading Indonesian assets, citing rising fiscal risks from a series of initiatives by President Prabowo Subianto.
title: Goldman Downgrades Indonesian Assets Amid Fiscal Risks

description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said he’s ready to be jailed amid speculation that the International Criminal Court has issued an arrest warrant against him over his drug war.
title: Duterte Says He’s Ready to Go to Prison Amid Talk of ICC Arrest

description: President Donald Trump said Sunday he was negotiating with four different possible buyers for TikTok’s US business and that a deal for the social video app could come “soon.”
title: Trump Says Four Different Groups in Play for TikTok Deal

description: US President Donald Trump said he had largely lifted a freeze on US intelligence sharing with Ukraine as he looked to push both Kyiv and Moscow to the negotiating table in hopes of brokering a peace deal.
title: US Freeze on Ukraine Intel Sharing Just About Lifted, Trump Says
